inclusion.criterion: Acute stroke with a demonstrated occlusion in the anterior circulation
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: MRI of the head revealed an acute 1.7-cm infarct of the right periventricular white matter and posterior right basal ganglia.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Intravenous recombinant tissue plasminogen activator (t-PA) was administered as well as high-dose statin therapy.

inclusion.criterion: Prestroke functional independence of 2 or less on the modified Rankin scale
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Baseline score of at least 6 points on the National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS)
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: His National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) score was calculated as 7.

exclusion.criterion: Evidence by imaging of a large ischemic core
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: Initial CT angiogram of head and neck reported no acute intracranial findings.

exclusion.criterion: Well-documented history of neuromuscular disorders, stroke or central nervous system tumors that could interfere in the SEPs assessment
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: 62-year-old African-American man with left upper and lower extremity weakness, associated with dark visual spot in right eye, right facial numbness, facial drop and slurred speech. He has hypertension, hyperlipidemia and hypothyroidism.
